Although it's a nested loop, total iterations will be almost always less than 10. Might be zero if arguments are not qualifying for a reward or reimbursement, or it might be withdrawn already."}},"withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(address,uint256,address,uint256[])":{"details":"Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. changeMultipliers(uint256,uint256,uint25.details: Changes the proportion of appeal fees that must be paid by winner.

params._loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: The new loser appeal period multiplier respect to MULTIPLIER_DIVISOR.
params._loserStakeMultiplier: The new loser stake multiplier value respect to MULTIPLIER_DIVISOR.
params._tieStakeMultiplier: The tie stake multiplier value respect to MULTIPLIER_DIVISOR.
params._winnerStakeMultiplier: The new winner stake multiplier value respect to MULTIPLIER_DIVISOR.

createDispute(address,bytes,string,uint2.details: TRUSTED. Calls createDispute function of the specified arbitrator to create a dispute. Note that we dont need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as its the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._arbitratorExtraData: Extra data for the arbitrator of prospective dispute.
params._metaevidenceURI: Link to metaevidence of prospective dispute.

returns.disputeID: Dispute id (on arbitrator side) of the dispute created.

fundAppeal(address,uint256,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Manages contributions and calls appeal function of the specified arbitrator to appeal a dispute. This function lets appeals be crowdfunded. Note that we dont need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as its the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._disputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._ruling: The ruling to which the caller wants to contribute.

returns.fullyFunded: Whether _ruling was fully funded after the call.

returns._loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: Multiplier for losers appeal period. The loser is given less time to fund its appeal to defend against last minute appeal funding attacks.
returns._tieStakeMultiplier: Stake multiplier in case of tie.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(address,uint2.details: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount. Although it's a nested loop, total iterations will be almost always less than 10. (Max number of rounds is 7 and it's very unlikely to have a contributor to contribute to more than 1 ruling option per round). Alternatively you can use Contribution events to calculate this off-chain.

params._contributedTo: The array which includes ruling options to search for potential withdrawal. Caller can obtain this information using Contribution events.
params._contributor: The contributor for which to query.
params._disputeID: The ID of the associated question.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

numberOfRulingOptions(address,uint256).details: Returns number of possible ruling options. Valid rulings are [0, return value].

params._disputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrable contract.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: To be called by the arbitrator of the dispute, to declare winning ruling.

params._externalDisputeID: ID of the dispute in arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: The ruling choice of the arbitration.

params._newGovernor: The address of the new governor.

submitEvidence(address,uint256,string).details: Allows to submit evidence for a given dispute.

params._disputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(address,uint256,a.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved.

params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._disputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.
params._ruling: The ruling option that the caller wants to withdraw fees and rewards related to it.

returns.sum: Reward amount that is to be withdrawn. Might be zero if arguments are not qualifying for a reward or reimbursement, or it might be withdrawn already.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(addre.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For multiple rulings options and for all rounds at once.

params._contributedTo: Rulings that received contributions from contributor.
params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._disputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForMultipleRulings.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved for multiple ruling options at once.

params._contributedTo: Rulings that received contributions from contributor.
params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._disputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.

devdoc.title: ArbitrableProxy  A general purpose arbitrable contract. Supports non-binary rulings.
